intro: Diasperus flagelliformis, commonly known as the whip grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, whip-like stems that can grow up to several meters in length. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, which are typical of the daisy family. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often forming dense mats on the ground. Diasperus flagelliformis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
